greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations of 3 copies of 1..n introduced in order 1..n with no element equal to another within a distance of 1.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..223 (terms 0..101 from Andrew Woods)
H. Eriksson, A. Martin, Enumeration of Carlitz multipermutations, arXiv:1702.04177 (2017)
R. J. Mathar, A class of multinomial permutations avoiding object clusters, vixra:1511.0015 (2015), sequence M_{c,3}/3!.
mathematica: a[n_] := 1/(6^n n!) Sum[(n+j)! Sum[Binomial[n, k] Binomial[2k, j] (-3)^(n + k - j), {k, Ceiling[j/2], n}], {j, 0, 2n}]; Array[a, 16] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 22 2017, after _Tani Akinari_'s code for A193638 *)
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_, May 21 2011
ext: a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 22 2017
